msContents.summary: Thin palm leaf used as a front guard folio is looks newer than the other folios of the manuscript. It seems that this is added later. Front guard folio has old shelf mark roman number 42 written in coral color and 35-3311 is written in blue pen. A sticker of printed number 42 is glued and it has number 65 written with blue ball pen. The original prakirit dialouges are maintained. The end is not exactly similar to the published the Mālavikāgnimitram. The Bharata sentence is diffrent than the published editions of the Mālavikāgnimitram.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numeration in the Left margin. last folio is not numbered. 1v-25r.
supportDesc.condition: All folio are broken. Mostly marginal and right side content is damaged.

handNote.desc: In the colophon tht title of the text is written as Mābavikāgnimitram. clean writing style.

additions.desc: [ha]riḥ [oṃ] (1 letter damaged due to broken edges)bhama (1 letter damaged due to broken edges). is written in the left margin of 1v.
on 1v numer 42 is written in the left margin in corol color. Numer 42 is also found in the left margin on folio 25r written in black pen.
